title: Bug 49890 - Nio Selector issue on Linux platform
description: Bug 49890 - Nio Selector issue on Linux platform. Created attachment 25997 [details]NioEndpoint.java and simple web applications. Sometimes, the server's CPU reaches 100% and stays at 100% until restarting the server. Reproduced with Java versions: 1.6.007, 1.6.018, 1.6.021. It is a duplicate of issue: Bug 46373. It seems that the Jetty guys fixed that problem: http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/JETTY937?focusedCommentId=168060&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:commenttabpanel. I added some logging to NioEndpoint.java.
OB: On Linux platform, with the added logging, it is observed that selector.select(timeout) sometimes returns zero keys.
EB: The expected behavior is that the server's CPU usage should not reach 100%, and normal operation should be maintained without the need for a server restart.
SR:
1. Open the web application.
2. Perform several requests, such as pressing F5 in the browser and holding the button.
3. Monitor the server's CPU usage for abnormal behavior.
